title: How to Disassemble, Clean and Reassemble a PS4 Slim

steps.title: Shut down and unplug the PS4 Slim.
steps.content: Shut down and unplug the PS4 Slim. Place it on an open table in a clean environment.

steps.title: Pull firmly on the front corners and front edge.
steps.content: Pull firmly on the front corners and front edge. Unclip the top cover, then slide it back to remove it. [1] X Research source Keep in mind, newer PS4 Slims which have not been dismantled before may require more firmness when pulling.

steps.title: Remove the cover to expose two metal plates:
steps.content: Remove the cover to expose two metal plates: One shielding the fan and heatsink and another reflective metal plate on top of the battery pack.

steps.title: Remove the screws.
steps.content: Remove the screws. Preferably, use a T8 or T9 Security Torx to remove the two long screws holding in the reflective metal plate. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the reflective metal plate and unscrew the other long screws holding in the rest of the battery pack.
steps.content: Remove the reflective metal plate and unscrew the other long screws holding in the rest of the battery pack.

steps.title: Lift up the battery pack just enough to be able to uncover the lip of the pack.
steps.content: Lift up the battery pack just enough to be able to uncover the lip of the pack. This will allow you to remove the metal plate shielding the fan and heatsink. Make sure you do not take out the entire battery pack, as there is no need to do so.

steps.title: Remove all the screws holding the metal plate and remove the plate to fully expose the fan and heatsink.
steps.content: Remove all the screws holding the metal plate and remove the plate to fully expose the fan and heatsink.

steps.title: Clean the outer vents.
steps.content: Clean the outer vents. Use a small brush and canned air to clean the outer vents and intake ports around the sides of the console.

steps.title: Clean the heatsink.
steps.content: Clean the heatsink. Use the same brush to clean the heatsink, as well as canned air for a deeper clean. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Clean the fan and blades.
steps.content: Clean the fan and blades. Use canned air and cotton swabs dipped in rubbing alcohol to thoroughly clean the fan and its blades. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place the metal plate used to cover the fan and heatsink back into its proper spot.
steps.content: Place the metal plate used to cover the fan and heatsink back into its proper spot. Screw back in the screws. This will be the most tedious part of the process, as it can be difficult to screw back in the screws due to their size.

steps.title: Firmly push down on the battery pack so it is fully locked back in place.
steps.content: Firmly push down on the battery pack so it is fully locked back in place. Proceed to screw in the screws.

steps.title: Put the reflective metal plate on top of the battery pack in its original spot.
steps.content: Put the reflective metal plate on top of the battery pack in its original spot. Once again, screw back in the screws.

steps.title: Slide and snap the top cover back into place.
steps.content: Slide and snap the top cover back into place.
